title: Caistor, Rothwell and Nettleton Walk Route

images.title: Tim Heaton / View towards Nettleton
images.caption: View towards Nettleton. A view across most of the square towards Nettleton, and Nettleton Hill, taken from the Viking Way as it leaves the A46 at Caistor

images.title: Tim Heaton / Entering Nettleton
images.caption: Entering Nettleton. The Viking Way joining the Mansgate Hill road into Nettleton.

images.title: Tim Heaton / The valley of Nettleton Beck, Lincolnshire Wolds
images.caption: The valley of Nettleton Beck, Lincolnshire Wolds. After overcast and drizzly days at the start of our walk from the northern end of the Viking Way, I am now beginning to fully enjoy the beauty of the Wolds.

images.title: Tim Heaton / Nettleton Beck Valley (upper part)
images.caption: Nettleton Beck Valley (upper part). The beck - an inconsequential trickle to the left of the fence - occupies a fine and distinctive valley in the Lincolnshire wolds. The Viking Way follows it for over two miles.

images.title: Richard Croft / The Blacksmith's Arms
images.caption: The Blacksmith's Arms. The Blacksmith's Arms in Rothwell sells excellent Bateman's beers and good food - the perfect rendezvous for walking in the wolds with refreshments afterwards.

description: This circular walk from the Roman Town of Caistor takes you through the countryside to the neighbouring villages of Nettleton and Rothwell. There's some lovely Lincolnshire Wolds scenery and attractive villages to see on the route. Caistor has many attractive Georgian buildings but dates back to as Roman times. Nettleton , has an interesting Ironstone mining history, while Rothwell boasts a fine old pub where you can stop off for refreshments on the walk. The walk starts in Caistor where you can pick up the Viking Way and follow the waymarked trail south along the Nettleton Brook towards Nettleton and Normanby le Wold. Before you reach Normanby you turn east along a track to take you to the pretty little village of Rothwell. From here you head north before another bridle track takes you west back towards Nettleton.
